data.title: Mignon Corporation, New York
data.text:
See also Wikipedia article: en:Estey Organ#Estey-Welte, an unrelated competitor.

Further reading

[edit]

M. Welte & Sons, New York (1865-c.1917) by Emil Welte

Story of the Welte Company. Seewen SO: Museum für Musikautomaten.

"​ In 1865 Emil Welte (1841-1923, the founder's son) established a subsidiary in New York under the name M. Welte & Sons; the venture lasted until 1917. As a German enterprise, it was ordered to cease trading during the First World War. "

M. Welte & Sons. Inc., New York (1912-?)

The History of M. Welte & Sons, Freiburg and New York (wiki). (welte-mignon.de).

"​ In 1912 an new company was founded, the „M. Welte & Sons. Inc.“ in New York, which built a new factory in Poughkeepsie, N.Y. / [image 2] The Factory Building in Poughkeepsie, N.Y. about 1913 "

Note: source is unclear!

Welte-Mignon Corporation, New York (circa 1920s)

Charles Davis Smith, Richard J. Howe (1994) The Welte-Mignon - Its Music and Musicians, Vestal, New York: Vestal Press, pp. 66, 88, 91, ..., 160. ISBN: 978-1-879511-17-0.

"​Welte-Mignon Corporation (1920, and 1920s as restructured) ... "

Welte-Mignon Piano Service Company, New York / Welte-Mignon Piano Corporation, New York (circa 1930s-40s ?, or 1912 ?)

Welte-Mignon Piano Service Company / Welte-Mignon Piano Corporation / Otto Kremp, President - text and photos courtesy Gerhard Dangel-Reese, Augustinermuseum, Freiburg im Breisgau. Gallery. Mechanical Music Digest (mmdigest.com) (2000-02-11, 2000-12-12).
